Description: Microscopic fungus observed in diseased tubers. Later identified as Phytophthora infestans.
Damp, cold, foggy weather believed to weaken plants and cause blight.
Hypothesized that insects damaged the plants, leading to secondary fungal infections.
Overuse of manure leading to nutrient imbalances and plant weakness.
Repeated planting of the same seed tubers without refreshing genetic stock led to susceptibility.
Potatoes from Nova Scotia, France, and South America suspected of introducing the disease.
